name: George Manis
content: George Manis Home                                                                 Teaching                                                                 Research George Manis Associate Professor Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering, School of Engineering University of Ioannina, Ioannina, 45110, Greece Guest Editor in Entropy: Special Issue on Entropy in Biomedical Engineering The issue is now open for submission Contact: manis -at- cs -dot- uoi -dot- gr Member of the IPAN lab Academic Degrees: - PhD from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Division of Computer Science, National Technical University of Athens, Greece, 1993-1997 - MSc in Advanced Methods in Computer Science, Distributed and Parallel Systems, Queen Mary, University of London, UK, 1992-1993 - Diploma (5 years degree), School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, National Technical University of Athens, Greece, 1987-1992 Teaching: - Postgraduate Courses: Introduction to Data Analysis and Processing Biomedical Data Analysis and Processing - Undergraduate Courses: Compilers I Compilers II Research Interests: - Biomedical Engineering Entropy Analysis Bubble Entropy [more] Fast Computation Algorithms [more] Biomedical Data Classification [more] Heart Rate Analysis [more] - Computing Systems [more] Current Funded Projects: - Palimpsest: Post Alphabetic Interactive Museum using Participatory, Space-Embedded, Story-Telling - Homore: Smart System for the Monitoring of the Normal Living of Elderly People in Urban and Rural Areas
